settings.title: "Well-aging Skincare"
settings.description:
This blog has been established to share numerous stories, as well as provide valuable tips and information related to the topics of 'aging' and 'how to age well!


The term "well-aging" is frequently employed to describe the process of aging in a positive and healthy manner. It places emphasis not only on extending one's lifespan but also on improving the overall quality of life as individuals age. Well-aging encompasses the maintenance of physical, mental, and emotional well-being as we progress through the various stages of life. It encompasses a wide range of lifestyle choices, habits, and practices that contribute to a higher quality of life during the later years.


In 2017, Boutijour was founded as a clean anti-aging brand specifically designed for individuals with sensitive skin, offering effective skincare solutions for modern individuals leading busy lives. After years of research into the aging process and various skin concerns affecting contemporary individuals, we have developed a purifying and revitalizing flower, Lotus, combined with a high-performance natural formula, to serve as the cornerstone of our 'well-aging' skincare regimen tailored to address the needs of aging skin in today's world.

settings.title: Why did you start well-aging skincare?
settings.description:
Interviewing our founder, Jillian J.Y. Yoo

At the age of 27, my skin and career were facing the hardest and most challenging times of my life. Due to heavy workloads at the advertising agency, hormonal changes, eating habits, and a lack of exercise and stress management, my skin had to endure severe dehydration and acne. I still remember how hard I tried to cure my acne and scars through countless methods, including dermatology, clinical laser treatments, and home care. My skin was diagnosed as dry, sensitive, acne-prone, with pigmentation issues and uneven skin tone. My skin's age was assessed as 32 at the age of 27. I discovered that various skin concerns, including dehydration occurring in one's 20s, can contribute to certain skin issues that might make your skin appear older or show signs of premature aging if not properly managed. I needed safe, trustworthy anti-aging skincare products suitable for sensitive skin. Moreover, my physical and mental health needed to be treated in a healthier way. Starting with proper skincare knowledge and ingredients, adopting wellness habits, exercising regularly, and improving my natural and organic eating habits helped me overcome my challenges. I found the proper way to care for my skin through a foundational understanding of the power of natural ingredients and skincare know-how.


Thesedays, the combination of increased life expectancy and accelerated aging has become a prominent issue, largely due to modern lifestyles, hectic daily routines, dietary choices, exposure to UV light, stress, and environmental factors. I, too, am experiencing the natural process of aging with each passing year, and it has inspired me to share professional know-hows to prevent skin aging, allowing individuals to age beautifully and gracefully.

settings.title: It's the brand that we can all age gracefully.
settings.description:
"To us, aging is an adventure. I find a better self in my 30s, and I'm still discovering my voyage. We enjoy every natural process of aging and feel grateful to have each and every moment, even imperfect cheek freckles and pigmentation by the sunlight and fine lines when I smile too hard."


We will discover more interesting journeys during the process of aging. BOUTIJOUR will cover your 'skin aging' needs with years of skin know-hows from Korea and advanced well-aging skincare, which treats not only your skin but also your body and mind, leading to the healthiest dewy glow.


To us, well-aging' is all about embracing who we are today with gratitude, enjoying the presence with an open-minded heart and a healthy state of mind, skin, and body. So let's start our well-aging journey and get in the mood for the healthiest and most graceful journey."
